text: This place is very small and the food was great!! My husband and I ordered the garlic knots and a small deep dish and it was more than enough for the both of us!! Bread is so filling and yummy. I also ordered the "all nighter" blonde ale, very good!! They need to hire more valuable workers though. The bartender barely even glanced at us when we walked in and there were no clean tables to sit at. There was one gentleman working (I regret not asking his name) but you could tell he was hustling to serve. He cleaned our table as quickly as he could and provided us excellent service the rest of the evening!

I stayed 3 days and 2 nights at the Golden Nugget. The Four Queens is right next door and i wanted to try this place for the beer. My wife and i had the blonde,  brown, hef and stout.  They were all great.  We went 4 times during our stay.  The Chicago deep dish was awesome. We also had the sliders, wings,  fries and potato skins.  All of it was good. We meet 4 of the servers/bar tenders.  They were all nice and good company.  The next time we hit up Vegas, this will be our place to eat.  

Keep in mind it's a small place in the casino.  We love the local atmosphere.

If you need a quick, cheap bite on Fremont this is the place. They have great beer, service and food. I had wings and a burger and both were delicious. My husband had a Philly cheese steak and said it was too salty for his taste though. Overall this was quick and easy for us to take a break from gambling. Also, I should note that there is a cigar bar of some sort attached to the restaurant. I was nervous about this at first, but we experienced no smell or smoke from that section.

This place is a gem and one of my favorites every time I visit Vegas.  The staff is always awesome, the food is great (amazing for the price) and the beers are decent.  (I would say in past years the brew was a little better than this trip, but still tasty enough.)  

They've added a non-smoking section so if you don't like cigar smoke with your food, it's no longer an issue. 

Did I mention that the staff is awesome?  Hard to describe, but the whole vibe of the place is great.

The root beer is excellent. The flavor of the Chicago pizza is decent but tonight they had poor production. The pizza was paper-thin in the center and very thin for the rest of the bottom. The edges were like popovers and so thick the inside was doughy and not fully cooked. The sauce was so runny that after taking one piece out, the sauce actually ran out into the pan. There isn't any cornmeal in the crust either. Maybe it's better with different preparers, but tonight was not a good night for them.

I honestly did not have one sub-par item in this place. I ordered the 10 piece hot wings and my buddy ordered the 10 piece barbecue wings and they were both equally delicious. The beers were just as delicious as the wings. I ordered a brown ale that had a delicious nutty flavor. The garlic knots, as everyone else here has raved about, are garlic buttery heaven.

We had the white pizza and a glass of their homemade root beer.  The white pizza was delicious. We also had the potato skins, but they weren't anything special. I would definitely go back for the pizza. We stopped for lunch.  It's a small place with tvs to watch the game.

We each had two beer samplers in cute mini mugs, fried calamari and shared the deep dish pizza. 

The beer was good, but very "middle of the road." It didn't seem like they took a lot of chances with the beer and just went with what would sell.

The calamari was delicious, as was the deep dish pizza. It's only 9 inches, but it's more than enough for two people to share, especially after sampling a ton of beer!

The real stand out for me was the root beer. It was AMAZING! The server even made me a mixed drink with root beer and vanilla vodka. Delicious!
MEH.  Maybe I am spoiled at home, but this place would not pass for a 4 star in Houston.

Good Za' and nice beer selection, comfy environment with slots as far as the eye can see. Bartender topped off our beers (half empty on our way out) before we left! I recommend popping in here when you're on Fremont

As a pizza fanatic I always try to stop by when visiting Fremont for their Chicago Deep Dish and chicken wings then wash it all down with their tasty Brown ale. Step away from the excitement of the casino a bit and check out this Hidden gem inside the 4 queens and you will not be disappointed. Very relaxing environment. Servers are always friendly.
Service slow with no one in restaurant. Staff worried more about schedule than customers

I signed up for a yelp account JUST to save other people from going to this place. We had to go LOOK for a server to get his attention. The pizza here was awful, which means you're screwed because there's basically nothing else on the menu. This restaurant is also very tiny and.has limited seating and is far from the main drag. ...the two friends I was with also said their pizza was poor. One of them described their pizza crust as "tasting like charcoal." ...the beer was okay, except we went for dinner. Perhaps the other reviewers drank a little too much before posting their thoughts.
Like the place. Great prices, Not too expensive. Good food for a bar

Awesome Hefeweizen! 

Great food and the best bartenders around!

We always stop by when we're in town!

This is a great little place to relax downtown. They make some of the best microbrews in Las Vegas, and have some great food to go with it. The Cheesy Garlic Knots, and the Deep Dish Pizzas are my favorites.
Great beer, good appetizers, and fair to middling' meals. Pizza looked great. I would definitely come back, but be selective with the menu. And order the beer sampler!

I've eaten here twice since arriving on Las Vegas and both meals have been great, accompanied by superior service from Kierra and Bob. The IPA is insane and the foods has been yummy. I'll be back next trip If not before.

This happens to be the coolest little spot on downtown. Tucked away in the corner of the Four Queens, you will find some of the tastiest beers on Fremont.

Its got a typical pub food selection. Garlic Knots are a tasty. Anytime I bring people to see "Old Vegas" I slip them in here a little treat.

After a few trips, a solid personal pizza with great sauce.  Decent selection of sandwiches.  Tasty craft brew, try the amber.  Cigar after food, excellent. Big screen TVs for games, multiple locations so you're not struggling.  Don't go to Fremont Street if you're looking for good service people.  "'Cause this shit is REAL".  If the place is busy, it may be slow.  Forgive a little and enjoy the ride.

Love Kimmie and most of the bartenders here; the beers and food are very good, but the bartender with Kimmie on Xmas sucked.  20 minutes to get a menu and after an hour not even a look.  Had bad service from her before but played it off.  The gentlemen next to me were not even playing full quarters and got served several times.  Will go back but not if she is there!!!!!!

Stopped by for lunch.  Small bar food menu, but very good.  Had the Philly Steak Sandwich and an iced tea and hit the spot.  I love patronizing downtown businesses when I get the chance since I don't work too far away from there.  Have friends coming in next week staying at El Cortez so we'll probably have to hit this place in the evening when things are a little livelier.

Chicago Brewing Company in the Four Queens Casino is like an express version of the Fort Apache location - seat yourself and pay at the front on your way out.  That said, they still take your order and deliver your food tableside.  It's quick, high-quality and reasonably priced for being in a downtown casino.  The 22oz drafts are $5.  My favorite brew is the Ramblin' Wreck which is a cross between a Smithwicks and a Guiness.  The large pizza is crisp, tastey, plenty for two people and starts  is about $16 for a cheese version.  This location doesn't have a happy hour.   They have lots of TVs so you can catch your favorite game.  The place is kind of small so you'll have difficulties with groups larger than about 6 people.

The only place better for pizza downtown is the Grotto in Golden Nugget.  You will pay more at the Grotto unless you go during the weekday happy hour.
I liked the other location so much i had to go to this one and i was not disappointed. Their chicago deep dish pizza is on point. Good stuff!

Great spot off the Fremont street. The food was ok but the real spot light for this place is the beer, They also have a cigar lounge that I thought was cool. We will always have to spot by when in town.

This was convenient to our hotel and we were looking forward to trying their brews.  My companion said his beer was too "young" (underdeveloped). My gimlet was fine, and didn't cost much ($7), but it took 4 requests to 3 different staff before I got the glass of water I wanted.  Menu was typical (pizza, burgers, sandwiches) but the calamari was done nicely and the portion generous.
Not to chab very clean good beers. I got the sampler 9 different beers all good not a bad beer in the  house check it out

This place is pretty small, generally cold, and sometimes pretty smoky but it's a great place to watch any Chicago sports teams. The food menu is pretty basic bar food. Prices are very reasonable & portions are large. I got chicken fingers tossed in hot sauce, served with blue cheese dressing & veggies. It was tasty...huge I couldn't finish it. My husband got a Chicago dog that he really enjoyed. They have their own microbrews that are pretty good too. Service is always great every time we go.
4 star pizza 3 star chicken wings. 4 star staff. Something different in downtown Las Vegas. Cozy bar upstairs. They'll treat you right.

Still a hidden gem that should not go in-noticed! And rumor has it that Bloody Mary Sundays are on the horizon 
Great Service Great Food Great Bartenders 
Awesome Staff
Amazing Food coming from the Kitchen

As much as I love the pizza and the brew here, today the bar staff failed sorely at holding thier shift together.  We were super-happy to settle in to a bar seat and order the brown ale and chicago pizza.  17 minutes later, we still had no beer or water.  I know the pizza takes time and we were prepared for that. However, we watched the bar staff have internal drama while our hydration needs were overlooked.  Extremely poor form on the barstaffs' behalf. Enough to make my man want to walk out.  I had to support him.  As we walked away,  we got a 'thank you' from one of the bartenders who never made eye contact when we were looking for service, serveral minutes after the bartender who took our order---and never fullfilled it--stormed off into a back room.
great stouts!!!!!!! Food is awesome, service so/so, place is clean, and has really cool decor. I'd visit again.
We went here just looking for a quick bite to eat and turned out to be some of the best and most affordable food we had while in Vegas. Super friendly staff too!

Good food uplifts this place to the 4th star frontier. Probably just average brews, but their huge double-decker brewery flight and comparison to other local options, it is definitely worth a visit.  This was the fourth LV based brewey I visited, and my second favorite (second to Triple 7)

The double decker sampler tray comes with 9 samples:
*  Weizenheimer - regular Hef
*  Blueberry Hef - seasonal, different, but interesting flavor
*  All Nighter - light Ale tasty and easy drinking
*  Ramblin Reck Amber -yummy - my favorite
*  Hardway IPA - solid at 6.2% ABV
*  Black Widow Stout - not my fav. Too tart for a stout
*  Root beer very good
*  Black and Tan okay (mixture of the stout and All nighter)

I enjoyed the happy hour prices on the appetizers which included a pretty yummy 3 burger filet mignon slider.

Visited them while we were in LV for SEMA/AAPEX .. great pizza! Small place but service was spot on .. clean, couldn't really smell the smoke from the casino .. that's a plus for me!!
Check this place out
Craft beers are good, pizza is good .. I don't think you'll be disappointed!
We enjoyed some Chicago-style pizza, bread puffs, and stuffed mushrooms here.  I really enjoyed their house brewed beer.

Thank you Yelp for this great little surprise find. My wife randomly saw a brewery mentioned on Yelp while we were wandering around Fremont and given that we were in the early stages of a challenge to try 100 new beers while on our US holiday, we dropped all other plans and headed straight here.

Chicago Brewing Co is tucked away at the back of the casino floor and if we weren't looking for it we would have completely missed it. We headed up the stairs and grabbed a table overlooking the floor for a spot of people watching and upon seeing they had a beer flight we promptly ordered one each. At first we wanted to order our drinks at the bar, but the bartender told us he was finishing his shift now and would send someone over to our table. He then proceeded to stand around talking for five minutes and playing around with his phone behind the bar before someone came to take our drinks order. They were taken by a very friendly waitress however and once ordered, the drinks came out very quickly.

The flight is huge. 9 beers (well..8 and a non alcoholic, but nonetheless tasty Root Beer) on a double decker tray made me very happy and glad the the car was staying put in the parking garage for another day. Now, it was a couple of months and a lot of drinks ago when we ordered here so I'll just pop in how I rated each beer on Untappd, because I really can't remember much of them.

All Nighter: 3/5
Weizenheimer: 4/5
Ramblin Reck: 3/5
Blueberry Vanilla Wheat: 3/5
Hardway IPA: 4/5
Old Town Brown: 4/5
Black and Tan: 4/5
Black Widow Stout: 4/5

I like my beers dark, so they were either really good to get that many 4's at the end or I was just getting drunk. Either way they were tasty and definitely worth stopping in for a try. 

Oh, and hit the toilets before you get into the bar. There aren't any inside and you have to walk all the way back across the casino floor to get to the closest ones.

Looking for a great tasting restaurant with a cheap price in Vegas? Look no further - Chicago Brewing Company is your place. Located in the Four Queens Casino in Fremont. Good pizza, good beer, good service. 

We started with some garlic knots which were greasy and great! We also tried the beer sampler (9 flavors), and then moved on to a pitcher of some type of Mango beer - really good. Last, we split a deep dish pizza (pepperoni & sausage). All delicious. Highly recommended.

A Vegas favorite. House brews are delicious. Deep dish pizza and blackened chicken quesadilla are a must. They have cigars on site if you're in the mood, too.

Love the atmosphere, helpings and prices.

Been dozens of times.

Always a great spot to grab a bite and beer while staying in Vegas. All food is good and the prices are good too. For beers they have around 6 fine examples on tap. Solid and underrated in my opinion!
We were starving when we arrived here so we checked this out since we love breweries. Pretty good IPA I must say, the food was delish as well.
The beers are great! So are the sliders and garlic knots. My husband and I stopped in for lunch. The staff is super friendly also.
Great place!   We ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and it was the best I've ever had.

We had to stop in and try their brews while in Las Vegas, right? In the far back corner, up some dark stairs in the Four Queens casino is a divey and smokey brewpub that hit the spot! We got a full sampler, including their Root Beer and recent GABF award winner. They were all pretty tasty as I recall.

The dark pub had screens with sports, video gambling on the bar and a few other tables where large groups were dining. The service was great and the vibe was relaxing. My only criticism is that there was no way to remember which beer was which. They were served and pointed out, but remembering which is what of about 10 samples was a little challenging.

Otherwise, this place was great & I will definitely return!

The downtown location is small but the beer is awesome.  When we went few weeks ago the seasonal beer was a blueberry vanilla wheat beer.  Man it was good!  My father-in-law had the sampler and all the beers were very tasty.  I REALLY enjoyed the hot wings and the deep dish pizza.  Will be back next time we are in Vegas.

Stopped in here because La Comida closed earlier then they advertise (boo). I wasn't really in the mood for pizza, but hot damn, this was really good! I was really surprised to see a line forming outside of that other 24/7 place inside 4 Queens. I have eaten their before, just typical late night menu. But anyhow, went in to the Chicago Brewery and ordered the white pizza and their lightest IPA. The place was dead, which shocked me cause the food was so gooood! Delicious and super cheap! They are open until 1:30am every night and since I am a night owl, I will be back!

My favorite place downtown.  Great pizza (we've only done their thin crust).  Good to great appetizers.  Excellent beer.  And an outstanding root beer (I can't think of better).

Friendly place with a friendly (hustling) staff.  They will accommodate groups.  A don't-miss Happy Hour.  They'll validate your parking.  It's 4 1/2 stars.  A little dark, and a little small to come up with the fifth star.

We ALWAYS eat here when hitting up Freemont St and now our nephew/younger cousins hit it up as well. The garlic knots are great and even with 5 of us (4 being big time guy eaters!) we can get by with sharing the knots and 2 large pizzas! Where else can you feed 5 and get a few pitchers for under $100! Definitely a hidden gem tucked up in the corner of Four Queens!

Our party ordered burgers, chicken strips and pizzas. All of it was DELICIOUS! The service was fast and very friendly.. Food was great quality for the price! Would definitely go here again if we weren't from Washington! Highly suggested :)
Amazing food!  Pizza is thin crust and delicious!  The quesadilla was the best I ever had. Blonde ale was yummy and service was great!

The menu looks delicious, but I'll never get to taste what's on it because I will never go here again. My two friends and I waited for 20 minutes and never got served, so we left. The staff didn't walk over to our table even once. There was one table across the way with guests who had finished their meals, and there were two men seated at the bar. They also waited and did not get greeted or served, so they left.


We were nicely dressed, friendly, and smiling. We did not deserve to be ignored like that.  

Don't waste your time here.

Where to start? Beer was not good. Focacia bread was not focacia it was a hamburger bun. Not bad...just not what was on the menu description for my sandwich. Mushrooms on the pizza were canned...yuck. Oh yeah, can't forget the lady vomiting at the table next to us. Other than the above, everything was just dandy.

This was my first time at this locations and it exceeded my expectations.
I took my parents here. It was their first time in Vegas.

When we told the server we were celebrating and ordered a scotch, he brought me more than a double. Food and drinks came out quickly. Everything was perfect. I could hardly tell that I was downtown and not at the Summerlin location.


It made me look good for choosing such a fantastic restaurant to celebrate with my parents.
Great pizza and really great Garlic Knots. Big and garlicky, took some home. The beer is so good. Try sampler, every beer was great. They also make their own Rootbeer.

Garlic Knots were good.  We tried based on prior yelp review.  Prices were actually decent for Vegas, but it's Fremont St so all the food is cheaper down there.  Waitress screwed up the order.  She didn't write it down so I was not confident she'd get it right... We both got burgers.  1/4 lb which is what I prefer.  The more toppings you put on it, the more it costs you.

Unusual combination of a pizzeria and cigar lounge happening at the same time. You can smoke a stogie while eating and drinking while gazing down at the casino crowd trying lady luck.
Just ate a huge salad slathered in a creamy garlic sauce , then a Chicago deep dish pizza all watered down with a pale craft beer. 
Stogie to follow.

My boyfriend and I are from san diego so we love our beer, we ordered the deep dish and a flight perfect for two people. The food and beer were delicious and reasonably priced $9 for a flight. It's not on the menu so ask your server, the guy with the beard was very informative and on point very good service.
Mozzarella sticks were ok. The calamari was awful. Philly was awful. Maybe just stop here for a drink.

This is a review for their location inside the Four Queens.

It is in a small space on the second level, overlooking the casino. There are gaming machines at the bar and the bartender took good care of us while we were playing. My friend is a home brewer and he likes to try local micro brews when we travel. He likes the Triple 7 better, but I preferred Chicago Brew Co. Their All-Nighter was great and I ended up getting a growler of it to take back to my room.

Escaped the pricey places on the strip and ventured downtown with the hubby.

The beer is great. The Greek Salad is nothing special... mostly just a platter of lettuce with a few sliced tomatoes, olives, feta tossed on. Menu said it had cucumbers in it... but I couldn't find them. The dressing was fine. DH had the house salad and was fine with it. We shared the 9 inch Chicago 'style' pizza. Not truly a deep dish pizza... just a layer of cheese and pepperoni/sausage. It collapsed and ran cheese everywhere inside the screaming hot pan. It tasted pretty good. I just get a little annoyed when the menu description doesn't match the product. 

I'd go back for the beer and pizza knowing what I'm actually getting.

The largest turn off about this place was the service. We were stoked on a brewing co, however, after waiting 20 minutes we actually had to go up and ask for help. It's really small. We had the IPA- the beer was great but unfiltered. I ordered chicken tenders, they were burnt, but other than that they would prob be good. My boyfriend got the Philly cheesesteak he wasn't impressed. My aunt got the filet mignon sliders and loved it!

Amazing bartenders and incredible happy hour with some great microbrews.  Love the All-nighter and all their crafted brews.

Great place to catch a game, and awesome setup to kick it with friends.

This location of Chicago Brewing is my favorite.  Located upstairs in 4 Queens, when we stay downtown, this is a must stop for us.  From the cool starlit sky above, to the helpful  bar staff, video poker that allows me to play long enough on medium fundage, to the actual beverages they sell, 

The beer itself is very good, although it seems that I have locked on to the hefeweizen and IPA.  

Don't tell too many people because it is a small area and last time we went, I had to take my IPA downstairs just to find a place to play.

We were looking for a place to eat in the later part of the evening. We had the garlic knots and chicken wings. They hit the spot for late night snack, but I am not sure if I would come here for dinner. Don't get me wrong, I liked it but didn't love it.

One thing of me being a social drinker is finding fantastic place to have me a cold one.  Where is a better place to go than an actual brewery.  I came to Chicago here at the 4 queens and even though I was in here for 30 minutes only I had one of the best dark stout beer ever.  Is call the Black Widow and I recommend this beer especially if your a dark beer drinker is delicious. tasty, amazing, orgasmic, and the best.  Oh yeah come on down and get freaky at Chicago.  I approve this message.

The previous reviews are very accurate. This is a solid place to eat. We had a greek salad, root beer, garlic cheese knots, a small white pizza and a deep dish (only choice was with peperoni and sausage so I did not eat that). Everything was good. We were seated right away and our food came out pretty fast. There was left over pizza and garlic knots and those were even better the next day reheated! Nice casual place to grab a bite to eat downtown.

Loved it! Microbrews, bbq wings, patriots football. Forgot i was in vegas. Staff was fast, cigar bar a
in addition. pretty cool lil place.

This is a restaurant located in the Four Queens Casino.  It's open until about midnight.  The bar serves typical bar food.  The real draw is that it is a microbrewery that serves craft beer.  They have about 8 different beers and they vary by type, typical of a normal microbrew.  I got the IPA and I thought it was quite good.

The food was ok, but was served in large portions.  It's typical bar food such as pizza, sandwiches and fried appetizers.  The french fries are really good for some reason, I don't know why.
Excellent pizza! Great prices! Stopped for a late night dinner and was not disappointed at all. Definitely recommend!

This little gem is tucked away in the Four Queens Casino on Fremont Street in downtown Vegas. The Chicago-style deep dish is amazing....lots of sauce, sausage & pepperoni....holy crap it's awesome!

They also have a very delicious (but small) selection of microbrewed beers that are very good as well! I cannot believe that, in all the times I've been to Vegas (my wife and I go a few times a year and always stay downtown) that I only experienced this place for the first time last week (NYE 2010). Prices are reasonable, service is friendly, highly recommend!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  In passing someone overheard my husband and I chatting about wanting pizza for supper..... he recommended Chicago Brewing (said he had been in Vegas 2 days and had already eaten there 3 times).  GREAT recommendation!  Service was second to none, as well as the pizza!!!  Definitely will be back!

Well , 
   This place shares a menu with another place on the property so some stuff is made there and other stuff like the muffuletta is made somewhere else and brought up . The muffuletta was so so . Definitely not a muffuletta   not what you may be expecting if you are from nawlins . 
   But the steak sliders are really great . They are made on site.  I hate sliders because of the ratio of meat to bread . But these things are tasty and more meat then bread . Plus the 9 beers for nine bucks is a great deal . ( yep its a sampler but a big sampler )  
I would like the management to ditch the menu items they do not make in house and do what they can do best .

Tough review only because I LOVE LOVE the real location on Sahara. I understand this location is basically tiny restaurant tucked upstairs in one corner of The Four Queens. So not much you can do. Truth the food, micro brews, and the service is fabulous. Right on point and more important consistent with the Sahara location. Just walking into the The Four Queens if your not going Hugo Cellar is like why am I even this is old dump of hotel. So kind of kills the vibe for me. Once you get upstairs the place is so tiny, hell of low ceiling, and kind of feel trapped in box with lack of places to move around in general. The times I have come only because had visitors from out of town staying downtown. Now that downtown has evolved then more then just hotels. Bars, Restaurant, and Banger Brewery competition lot more tough. Chicago Brewery falls in the OK category. 

The beer is the same craft beer get at the other location. I really like all of them. The food just ordered appetizers order of garlic knots and mozzarella sticks. The garlic knots love at Chicago Brewery. The knots always hot, moist, nice golden brown crust, and the marinara sauce dip them in brings it all together. The mozzarella stick was ok. Just your normal bar food  not something would recommend if looking for munchies while watching football games. Our server was on it the whole time.

Located in the Four Queens casino it's a nice respite from walking around downtown. The beers are middle of the road for each style....that's not a knock on them...they are what you expect for each style...nothing that pushes any boundries. Food wise it's solid as well, with pizza,burgers etc...a good pub menu and a good value for what you get.

Please save yourself the money!
To get started when we first walked in the place looked dingy, carpets looked like they havent been vacumed in days. We ordered the sampler ... The beer was warm... As far as the pizza ... I have had better frozen pizza ... It came out kinda burnt and was just gross... I only ate one slice ... Service is ok .. As a avid pizza eater I would recomend to skip it. So disapointed.
Excellent service and food Tiffany did great job food was hot and service was excellent!! Thank You.

Rott gut stale beer made from cheap ingredients.  Check
Bland pizza sauce straight from a can.  Check
Hardly any meat on the deep dish pizza.  Check
Burnt crust.  Check
Terrible service being completely forgotten about.  Check

Check please.

Please do not insult Chicago with this POS.

A decent micro brewery in the midst of one of my favorite casinos.  I've been here several times and played video poker while enjoying my huge brew. Service has always been kind and helpful.  On my latest trip I ordered the steak sliders. They were good.  Food here is pretty cheap for Vegas pricing and drinks are 'free' when gambling.  
Whenever I'm on Fremont Street, I always visit the Chicago Brewery.
Good beer. Good pizza. Bears game on the screen. Nuff said.

Great place to eat in old Vegas. The garlic knots are as everyone has said, superb. I also had a root beer which although could have been colder for my liking was very good. 

The personal Chicago style pizza was almost as good as Gino's East in Chicago which is the best pizza I have ever eaten. I could only mange to eat half and I can usually put away some pizza so if you have someone you could split it with I would suggest you try that first. 

I was surprised how small the place was considering the reviews I seen, and then to actually taste how good the food was I am surprised there is not a constant line out the casino door.

ICYDK: This small restaurant is located inside the casino so if you're sensitive to smell then you might want to reconsider. But if your a regular in Vegas you know it comes with the territory.

Craving some deep dish pizza I turned to trusty Yelp which lead us to this place.

Ordered were the wings and the deep dish and neither disappointed. Overall the food was 3.5 stars but I'm still on the search for the best deep dish pizza.

When you spend a large amount of time in the same area on a 5-day vacation, you inevitable find a spot or two that you become extremely comfortable with ... a place that becomes a home away from home. On my recent vacation in Vegas, one of those spots was the intimate and welcoming Chicago Brewing Company at the Four Queens. I visited them three times on my vacation, each time being served by Bob (the gentleman in Leila R's picture) I also ran into Bob once at the nearby Banger Brewing and had a great chat with him - it's always great when brewpubs employ people who have a true passion and knowledge for beer. Bob overheard me mention that I was running out of clothes due to my flight being delayed because of the nasty east coast weather, and when I went back for my final visit to Chicago Brewing the next day, Bob gave me an older 2XL t-shirt that they don't print anymore. (Thanks Bob!) Needless to say, the service here was outstanding.

Chicago Brewing's beer sampler is an outstanding deal - 9 different samples for $8.99. I enjoyed it so much, I got one each time that I went. They keep six year-around brews, plus root beer (which is included on the sampler) and typically have two seasonals. Unfortunately they only had one seasonal - an outstanding blueberry wheat brew - so the final beer was a different brew mix each time. It started with a traditional black and tan, the next was a mix of the Hefeweizen and IPA, and my last mix was 1/2 brown ale, 1/2 stout. All of their beers are great, but the blueberry wheat was my favorite. I also really liked their Hardway IPA - it had a nice hoppy flavor but not overpowering with hops. At 6.2%, it's like a "Session IPA+" The Black Widow Stout, an Irish Dry Stout, and the Weizenheimer Bavarian-style Hefeweizen also stood out for me. And their root beer is a great palette cleanser for the finish. 

My first visit was for the beer, but I was eyeing the food menu ... and the wonderful looking Chicago Deep Dish Pizza they were serving. So I made a second trip back specifically to get one of these bad boys. It's a personal 9" deep dish with sausage and pepperoni. The dough was great, cooked perfectly through, and it wasn't overly saucy as some deep dish pizzas are. I'd definitely get this again. 

On my last visit, I had no intention of eating ... until I heard it was half-price appetizers for happy hour daily. One thing caught my eye - filet mignon sliders. Topped with mushrooms and onions, and served with a side of au jus, these are like little French Dip sliders of pure awesomeness. 

My expectations for Chicago Brewing Company were low to be honest. I guess it's the location inside the older (but charming) Four Queens and its old-school, dimly-lit bar vibe. But those expectations were blown away. This is one of my favorite places in Downtown Vegas, and I'll be coming back on my next trip to Las Vegas.
Great service! Delicious food. Garlic knots we're amazing! Mike was our server and he was honest, friendly and on top of it. We Will definitely be going back!

Our waiter was amazing! We tried the sampler with the 9 beers they brew to decide and it was a great choice. The root beer is delicious. Didn't try the food but menu looks good. Definitely a good little spot!

We were greeted as we came in.  (So they knew we were there). Took 15 minutes for them to take a drink order.  (This is at 9:30pm, place was not busy). We ordered food at the same time as the drinks.  (Server wrote down our order). Waited another 15 minutes, never received our drinks yet.  Asked the server, that took our order, the status of our drinks and he replied: "Are you ready to order?".    I said we already ordered and we are waiting for our drinks.  He said "you did?" .  I tried to refresh his memory, but nothing.   I don't know if it was drugs or lack of sleep.   But we were done.  Place is a joke.
Pizza is very good. My husband and I shared the small all meat and added mushrooms & olives. Delicious. We also shared the Greek salad and it was very good too.

The pizza is great and the two servers were awesome. The beer is excellent.
overall A+ 
So when In Vegas stop at the 4 Queens casino and give Chicago Brewing Company a try

9 beers in their sampler. 'Nuff said, but I'll add more.

8 our of the 9 beers in the sampler we all agreed were good. I won't say which since that's too subjective.

Tried a variety of happy hour snacks. Excellent meatballs! A hint of spice and a nice sausage and beef blend. The mustard for the pretzels was surprisingly good; creamy.

Would definitely go back or recommend, however like many Vegas places it has indoor smoking and is a bit acrid.

You want beer pizza and wings this is the place to go, we sat at the bar, the bartender was awesome to us. We ordered wings, very hot and delicious, we ordered a thin crust meat pizza and let me tell you it was the bomb. One of the best pizzas i ever ate. Very fresh filling and yummy. We also had drinks my favorite is the root beer on tab. It was so good and cold. I like how you can play poker on the screens at the bar too. They are open late too. We just wanted a place where we could drink eat pizza and wings and gamble and have a great time. Will return here for sure, loved this place.
Good food, not great. They mean SMALL when ordering a small salad. Couldn't have been more than two lettuce leaves ripped up on a small saucer. Garlic knots were yummy :-)

Not like the location on the west side AT ALL!
The menu was tiny and food was mediocre- no flavor. Just not enjoyable at all (frozen pizza like) and super pricey. Nothing notable to say that was great. I would go elsewhere.
Love this place!  Best deep dish pizza and garlic knots and I always win at the keno at the bar!

This place ROCKS! Inside the 4 queens casino toward the back, small Chicago style brewery with fresh oven pizza and ice cold micro brews. The starter salad and 10" meat lovers pizza my wife and I had was perfect to share, I had a great all nighter beer and my wife enjoyed her root beer. Wish we had one of these brewery near our home in the Bay Area, 5 stars on Fremont street do yourself a favor go here and not the cheap pizza slice joint down the street. Same price for 2 slices there as a 10" oven fresh pizza!
Great service, great food, great atmosphere!!

The best deep dish pizza in Las Vegas!! It is the best pie since I visited Chitown. I'm no expert. But! I will eat the pie over any other I have had to date. Thank you for making this a pizza destination.

The cheesy bread was awesome.  The pizza was a mess.  Good beers, people at my table said.  The root beer was pretty fine.  But, when cheese and sauce is just falling everywhere, and when the attention to detail is not Lou Malnati's quality, I dock points on my ratings.

I came in here for dinner before going to a concert at the nearby Golden Nugget. I wanted to sit at the bar but my dad informed me that it was part of the 'cigar lounge', so we sat at a high table instead in the non-smoking part of the restaurant.
I didn't think about ordering the Chicago deep dish pizza and went for the Chicago Dog instead, and mind you, this thing is HUGE. The toppings they give you are relish, mustard, peppers, and onions. Believe it or not, I finished the entire thing along with a side of fries. The Chicago Dog has got to be one of the best hot dogs I've ever tried.
Though the restaurant is super small (located inside 4 Queens casino), I had a good dinner. Will definitely be back!

Pizza, garlic knots and beers are all pretty good.  Assuming you can get a server.

On my last trip, about 5 minutes after sitting down, a server dropped menus on our table without breaking stride and without saying a word.  Another 10 minutes passed and he didn't return, so... fuck it.  Lots of places to eat in Vegas.  The party at the next table had the same problem.

Tiny place, so seating can be a challenge.

I was a little unsure of eating here since it is next door to Magnolias and I am not a fan of that restaurant. This turned out to be Fremont Streets best kept secret. We ordered the brew wings and Muffaletta sandwich to share. The wings were crispy with a perfect amount of sauce and the sandwich was fresh. Our only criticism was the waitress could have been a little friendlier, (was not rude, just didnt smile or great us) however I have a great respect for anyone in the service industry in this town.

We visited June 18th. Of the 3 breweries I sampled in Vegas, Chicago Brewing had the best beer. The IPA was outstanding, not overly hoppy and lovely citrus overtones. I also thought the atmosphere and food was excellent to very good. I really enjoyed sitting in the cigar lounge overlooking the casino floor as hubby did a little gambling and I did a little drinking and people watching (no I don't smoke, but smoke smell was not overly offensive). We had an excellent pizza for dinner, husband enjoyed a root beer. Sure wished we would have ordered the garlic knots as suggested in the other reviews, especially regretted it when the table next door got an order...they smelled divine and I overheard them raving about them...but by then we were full and ready to move on. I would have given CBC 4 and a half stars if it were possible. Service was good and I wanted a beer w/ souvenir glass and they did not have them, so the guy tried to get me to buy some $15 glass, minor stuff.
Service was terrible, be aware that it's a cigar place, so it reeks of cigar smoke and the food was only ok.  The waiter didn't even bother coming back to see if we wanted a second beer.

Excellent little place inside the 4 queens casino, had the garlic knots and filet mignon sliders for appetizers with a wheat beer that was a great start for the delicious deep dish pizza filled with pepperoni and sausage!!! Must visit for any deep dish pizza or regular pizza fan!

My beer was amazing!!!! The taste was great!!! The atmosphere was fun!!! We had a group of 15 and they were very accommodating!! We love pizza so it was really gonna challenge us to go outside our own pizza box!!! We would have loved to get a big deep dish pizza but they only serve it in 9"!! Kind of a downfall:( we ordered a large meat pizza, thin crust!! Let me tell you it was superb!!! Sauce was just right, the amount of cheese was perfect!!!! And the wait staff was excellent!!! Definitely two thumbs up!!!!!!

Only in Vegas does one have to walk through a poorly ventilated casino and into a little cigar bar to get a craft beer.

We had a special deal in our Yelp Spring Break book for a $2.50 beer here which lured us in.  I went for a mango wheat (because wheat beer is pretty awesome and mangos are super awesome) only to find out they had switched it out for blueberry vanilla or some such thing.  Obviously better that your typical Bud Light/Heineken typically found in Vegas, but it tasted a bit like an air freshener.

It really wouldn't be a bad place to hang if it weren't for the cigar bar aspect, but we could only really handle it for a few minutes before we took our beers to go and lost some money in the slot machines.

We ordered the garlic knots and a 9 inch deep dish pizza. The garlic knots were decent, the pizza though was less than impressive.

Great list of beers at least.

Service here was EXTREMELY slow. All the other tables had at least 4 people so again I think we were viewed as the least important table. Our server was never apologetic for the waiting either. Just about scrapes 3 stars, we definitely wouldn't return.
Great crispy wings, pizza and filet mignon sliders, highly recommend! Only down side is all the smoke! It is a cigar bar after all. Prices are fair too

Great service. We sat at the rail and received excellent service from three different bartenders. They were all working in synchronized harmony making sure that we we're well taken care of.

The Beer: we got the sampler which had 9 tastes for only $8! The IPA was almost perfect for me, floral flavors with lots of hops :) The seasonal was a vanilla blueberry heffeweizen, which was just so uniquely tasty. I thought it would be too sweet for me but it was a perfectly refreshing summer beer.

The Food: the garlic chicken pizza was very flavorful and just the right size for yourself or for two if you shared it with a salad, which we did. The salad was just simple field greens with tomatoes and onions. It was just good enough.

Overall I was just so happy to find good craft beer, brewed in Vegas. Everything else were great surprise bonuses. Can't wait to come back ;)

So this time around my husband and I came here because he was looking for a cigar lounge on Fremont Street. He visited this place twice during our trip and had a great experience both times. When I came with him during one of his visits, we were greeted with a friendly waitress. We ordered drinks and pizza and watched the game, which was nice. There is not much of a menu, your normal bar food, but if you are looking for a nice chicago style deep dish pizza, come here and check it out.
Just to note: there are 2 sides to this place- the cigar lounge and the restaurant, so you can choose either side. 
Our bill for 4 drinks and the pizza was 36, which is good for Vegas. The only thing that complicated things with our visit was that the waitress got quite busy at times and so it took a while to get our check, but that was okay!

A hidden gem! The rambling wreck is the best beer in Vegas. I got the giant souvenir glass, which is an alcoholic's wet dream. Thin crust pizza was very tasty. Only complaint, for a cigar friendly bar, the ventilation was bad on the couches. Will be back next time, won't waste any more time at triple 7, this is the real deal!

I like the Filet Mignon sliders, garlic knots and the thin crust pizza.  They are really good.  My complaint would be: I think it's too expensive for the kind of food.  $11 for three sliders!  Maybe I could see it if they piled the meat on them, but they don't.  Just one very thin layer of meat.  $14 for a pitcher of beer! 

I make it a point to go during "happy hour". The appetisers are half price then. Also you can use your 4 Queens players card and get money off the bill (if you have any comps due).

I also feel the service here is painfully slow.

They open at 11:30, but it was 11:34 before they opened up. Not a huge deal, just a pet peeve. We went to sit at a table and it was still dirty from the night before, but the waiter quickly wiped it down (and he also later wiped down the other tables in the dining room).
We ordered the garlic knots and the 9" deep dish pepperoni. We're from Illinois but have lived in Denver for the last year where the pizza is terrible so we were looking forward to good pizza.
First, the garlic knots are a great value. I think we got about 7 of them for $4.99. They're large knots too. They're more on the flaky side vs. Chewy. Good though.
The deep dish was also quite good. It's no Gino's East, but still good. The sauce isn't quite as chunky as you'd find in Chicago, but frankly, I prefer a smoother sauce. Server did a good job and was friendly and prompt with refills. 
Overall, I'd definitely come back again.

Chicago style deepdish was great. I don't know how true to the original their pizza is as I have never been to Chicago, but I thought it tasted fantastic. What an unlikely place to find it too. The beer was quite nice. I have had quite a few IPAs and consider myself somewhat of an aficionado and theirs definitely stood out.  Deff

This place is just decent. Place was packed, which shocked me. We were able to find a table (connected to others) and our waiter took forever- poor thing was the only one running around like a chicken with his head cut off. He was really nice though. Food was decent- they forgot our potato skins which was the reason we were there LOL! The manager ended up comping our sodas which again, was really nice. This place may be better during off times...

So far, the best place I've been to in Las Vegas for craft beers in a brewpub.
Lower original gravity=less taste, and most places are mailing in their versions of different styles on the lower end of the ranges. The beers here are more true to style, with more taste. 
I'll admit that I'm spoiled living in the Pacific NW, so the brewpubs in LV wouldn't last long there, but are still a major step above BMC beers.
Chicago Brewing's amber is solid, their pale is solid, their IPA is good but not overpowering with bitterness. Had a great weizenbock seasonal here once too. Generally good beers.
The pub overlooks the 4 Queens casino, and has a cigar case. Smoking and non smoking areas since they expanded.
Very good service, very nice and friendly servers who take good care of you while there. 
The pizza is good, and the other food on the menu is better than average bar fare.
Worth checking out if you want something more than Bud, Miller, or Heineken for beers while visiting Las Vegas.

I stayed at the Four Queens and there was a coupon for buy one get one free beer and we went to try it out. The beer was good. The place was nice and cozy. The food menu looked good and it was reasonable priced. The staff was very nice and friendly, even gave me a miniature draft as I was cashing out.
Beer Hot !! 101%. Chicago 9' Pizza +\-  but service guy... Terrific this men never smile for  a second. Bad experience sorry.  My friend send me to this place. Never back a gain.

Best deep dish pizza I have ever had! And if I were to have a last meal on earth.... the chicken wings, a deep dish pizza, and a 22oz glass of the "All Nighter" beer would be it!

Our family has been coming here as part of our Thanksgiving tradition for over 10 years! This hidden gem is located in the 4 Queens hotel. It is located upstairs near the Golden Nugget side of the casino. They have a bar area with about 15 seats at the bar, and then about 5 high top round table that seat 4-8 people. They also have a cigar lounge with couches to sit on while smoking your stogie.

The chicken wings come in an order of 10. They have various sauces but we usually stick with the mild buffalo sauce. Very tasty!! The star of this place, in my opinion, is the deep dish pizza. It comes in a small personal pan, split into 4 pieces. Don't let the size fool you. This pizza is smothered in cheese, on top of a light, but doughy thick crust. The pizza also comes with sausage and pepperoni embedded into the cheese. I once ate the whole thing, and then slipped into a food coma! lol! My Fiancee and I split one pizza, and sometimes have one slice left over. 

This place is also part of a brewery. The serve their own craft beers ranging from a light pilsner, to an amber ale, an IPA, and a stout. I have had the pilsner and amber ale and thoroughly enjoy them. 

If I were ever to stand by a 5 star rating this is the one! The service is fantastic! The pizza is fantastic! The wings are fantastic! And the fact that it is still a hidden gem is fantastic!
Great experience good food great beer the garlic knots are the best ... Kimmie was the best server we have had in years..

Tasty Beers ina nice intimate atmosphere CHECK! AWESOME PIZZA, CHECK! GARLIC KNOTS TO DIE FOR, CHECK!!!!! 

The IPA here is one of the best in Vegas, it is well balanced with a wonderful hop aroma, and a nice hoppy finish!! The Heffe is also a very nice true to style Bavarian Heffe with hints of bubblegum and clove, and that twinge of banana in the finish.

I prefer the thin crust pie with buffalo Mozz on it, delicious!!! 

This is a sattelite location, and no brewing is done on site, but if you are down on fremont, and looking for a tasty adult Beverage, and some good greasy grub, this is your kind of place MERICA!!!

I have been craving Chicago style pizza for a long while and for my 4 year work anniversary at Zappos, my co-workers took me to this place to celebrate.

It's a small venue, I like that it is split where you can smoke cigars on one side and non smoking on the other. 

We sat and in a very short time later, Bob, our amazing server was there to greet us and grab our drink orders.

I would recommend this place to anyone who is in the Fremont area! 

The Chicago style pizza was just what I wanted. The sauce is delicious, the mozzarella cheese oozes when you pull a slice, I love that!

The Filet Mignon sliders are amazing, you can literally cut into it with a fork, that's how tender they are!

I wasn't a fan of the chicken wings, they were over cooked and dry, so I wouldn't recommend ordering that.

The calamari & the quesadilla was alright, it doesn't really stand out. 

The customer service is amazing, request for Bob to help you out, the atmosphere is great, stop in and have fun and enjoy some good food!
This is such a gem! Pizza is fantastic, service is amazing, and it's fun to watch the casino floor! Did I mention the pizza was fantastic?

Wow I wish we had come here early in our trip to Vegas, I had read about it but didn't go until our last night. This is a hidden gem at the back or the 4 Queens casino on Fremont st with excellent craft beer and tasty appys, and because it was happy hour (3pm - 6pm) they were half price, as well the beer $3 for a 14oz during happy hour. I would highly recommend the filet mignons sliders, generous helping of caramelized onions, and sauted mushrooms. If all that wasn't enough the staff was very friendly and very passionate about beer. 
  My wife and I will definitely be back here on our next trip.

My boyfriend (who's from Chicago) & I came here from Santa Barbara (we were visiting Vegas) to watch his Chicago Blackhawks vs. New Jersey Devils & it was such an awesome experience!  We ordered the Tower of Beer sampler, garlic knots, & deep dish pizza.  Everything was great!  From the food to the wait staff, it was such a laidback atmosphere. To top it all off, the Chicago Blackhawks won & went on to win the Stanley Cup!  My boyfriend was so happy lol.

I came here for a quick cheap lunch (fuel)....
I left with a T-shirt and a to-go cup of Stout.

The ambience lacks pizazz, but we sat at the casino-view table for prime people- watching (the joint is elevated a little bit above the casino so the view is good).

The sandwich wrap I had was decent, and huge enough to share.
Our servier was friendly and quick.

Try the beer flight...it's a great deal, and this place actually brews some fairley decent brew.  

FYI
There's a cigar bar attached to it, so you might wanna sniff before you sit.

Tucked in the Queens hotel on Fremont st. The pizza was just okay! It wasn't nearly close to anything I've ever had, but it isn't terrible either. The fries here though, are addicting!! The service was also great, which always makes things more pleasant. The ambience here is a bit dark. You can see the Queens casino floor from inside the restaurant, which you'll also have to walk through for the restroom bc the restaurant does not have their own. This is also a cigar bar it looked like. They had cigars in the cases and the bar had gambling machines as well! Wouldn't see myself here again unless I'm starving and walking through Fremont St.
Excellent food and service. Love the deep dish and beer selection.

Great place to watch a game on the tv, drink, and smoke a cigar or two. I liked the deep dish pizza and the appetizers. So great atmosphere, food, and drinks. Just be warned its a cigar bar too. So don't be surprised to see people smoking a stick.

Some of the best beer you will get in Vegas. I love the Old Town Brown and the Weizenheimer. The garlic knots are excellent and they are incredibly cheap at happy hour.  The deep dish pizza is good but I don't think it's great. It pretty much falls completely apart when you try to get a slice. The bartenders are always cool friendly people but be warned, you may be waiting a long time for a beer. The service is always very slow despite the friendly staff.  You could be the only person in the entire bar and still be waiting with an empty glass. That's the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars. A great pregame spot when you want to hang out downtown.

This is a must stop whenever I am in Vegas. The pizza is freaking awesome, I love the filet mignon sliders, and the beer is pretty damn good. I stopped in earlier this week and tried their seasonal beer - Belgian Saison. Total thumbs up!

Went there a few weeks ago and fell in love with it. Great home brews, pizza and the flights they have aren't 4 little 2 oz pours, they are 8-12 glasses. awesome. great staff and great price. will def. be back

came here with some buddies after finding out about this place on thrillist. the food was great. we ordered some wings and fried calamari for appetizers. then we each ordered our own deep dish pizzas which were extremely delicious! the waitress, I can't remember her name but she was very pretty and was really great. I noticed that she didn't write a single thing down and got every single aspect of our order correct. I thought that was pretty amazing. we ordered the hef, it wasn't the greatest hef I've had, it was a little flat and light, wish we had time to try more of their beers. will definitely go back next time I'm in Las Vegas.

My nephew took my wife and I there and it brought back some old school memories. The food was very good it also had a cigar lounge and the beer very tasty tasty. My very first stop when I hit Vegas again,

This place is truly a hidden gem in downtown -- it's tucked away in a corner of the Four Queens and it's very easy to miss.

Absolutely amazing pizza.  The 9 inch personal deep dish with all the meats is only $10 and is huge.  It's so good.  Varying soft & crunchy crust, not too oily, and just a slight bit of sweetness to the sauce.

Service was fine even though it was kinda busy because of sports.
Horrible example of deep dish or any pizza for that matter. Would probably go to Dominos before ever come back here.
Been here three of four times now. excellent beer, nice little place, sit smoke a cigar, get away from the slots for a time. I'd definitely go here again. Oh and Ask for Kimmie.

Come here for the beer only. The food we had was awful. We had the chicken wings as appetizers. They were not cooked well. She had the burger. The fries were the only good thing. I had a sandwich with 3 types of meat. Too salty and on one of the bites I heard a hard crack sound.  It was a bone. Her soda was watered down. Like I said the beer was the only thing good.

What a great place. My father and I came here Friday from San Diego around 2:30 and had a great time. Ordered the chicken fingers as an appetizer and had a thin crust pizza for lunch. Food was great. Service was even better. Our server/bartender Tiffany i believe but receipt says Kimber was off the charts great. She greeted us with an awesome smile and followed through with a great  customer service passion. She should be applauded. About 5'9 Brunette lady. Awesome smile. Really good. 
Thanks
William
San Diego

Difficult place to get to since you either go up the stairs to the third floor or take the Elevator to the third floor and walk through Magnolias restaurant which is a very tight walk through with all the tables and chairs. Once inside the restaurant which is very small you can sit on the 21 and over side or the family section. Food is pretty good and the prices reasonable. I had the Filet Mignon sliders which were good, but my family had the spicy chicken sandwich and meat pizza. My family said the spicy chicken sandwich was very delicious and the Pizza was awesome! I had the 9.00 dollar beer sampler which was more than enough beer! I highly recommend this place. Remember it's in the Four Queens casino.

Just ok, not much to write home about. Dark in here and only 2 tv's weird for a s bar that says its a sports bar. 
Had a club sandwich we split average price. Played video poker, asked if our drinks were comped cause we are playing, they adjusted the bill.
Maybe more a local place as the one server looked so unhappy to see us.

Deep.Dish.Pizza. 

Need I say more?! Give it a try! Soooo yum. I was literally swimming in cheese. They're super generous lol. 
Beers were okay. They seem to have the same beers on tap, nothing crazy special. The flight is a good deal if you're looking to just quench your thirst.
You can't beat this for the money. Great chicken fingers and pizza.

We've been coming to this place on every Vegas visit for years, this week we came nearly every day. I love the deep dish pizza. My husband loves that one side allows cigars, so he can watch sports and have a cigar. Great service from Mike and Bob. Great prices on beer and 1/2-price apps weekdays from 3 to 6.

Great place to recharge! The staff is super friendly in a not fake way and the bar food is actually really great! I have been to Vegas tons of times but never to old town and I'll be back now. It's a great place to grab a drink and good food and actually be able to sit. The filet mignon sliders, wings, and mozzarella sticks are yum! Plus check out the happy hour!!

Best Sunday football spot that we have found over 15+ years 

Lots of fun 
Great beer 
Great bar 
Great bartenders 

Can't go wrong spot
These guys are the shit! They serve amazing food and drinks, they're extremely friendly, quick and efficient. This place is a must.
This tucked away place is a favorite of mine because of how chill the bartenders are and my favorite coconut shrimp
Fantastic pizza and chicken wings.  Service can be spotty and the bar area can get really smokey with drunk tourists smoking cigars.  Still, it's darn good.
My wife and I shared the Garlic Knots and Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. Food was amazing and more than enough for both of us.  We'll worth it!

I was recommended this place, for good pizza. Error - its not good its GREAT
Clearly, one of the best pizza in LV. My colleague and I shared the Chicken White Pizza - Thin Crust - boy its was spot on - really high quality ingredients and well cooked -  I will return for take-out - only negative its in a pretty run down casino which is horribly noisy
Highly recommended to try this place out for Pizza
Good work by team there

Exceptional service and delicious food. I wish every place on the strip provided even half of the service this place does. One guy working the bar, taking orders, running food, refills and not one huff or puff - just a smile. Can't wait to come back !!

Waited 5 minutes at a table for service, another 5 minutes at the bar before ordering a flight of beer, and waited ten more minutes for it to be made. It wasn't the servers/bartenders fault though. Management decided to have him bartend/serve/run food/and apparently manage the whole place for lunch on a Thursday. Apparently they have 2 chefs to stand around in the kitchen though. The beer was good but come on. ... This place is located in a casino, wtf?
Mike was our server, and he was extremely courteous and helpful.  Uptown Roasted Garlic Chicken and the Chicago style deep dish pizzas were good choices for this afternoon.

As far as pizza places go there's not much that sets this place apart from anywhere else. 

My friend and I stopped in here while on Fremont Street and the first thing I noticed was just how small the place is. Despite the size, however, we did have to wait a bit to get served, probably due to the fact that you seat yourself here. 

We ordered the calamari for an appetizer which is served with marinara (mediocre) and garlic aioli (amazing - just the right amount of garlic flavor without being overwhelming). 

For the pizza, we skipped the Chicago style deep dish and went with a large thin crust meat lovers. Like I said before the pizza was average, not bad but not great either. 

The service seemed to get worse the longer we were there. While our food came out in a reasonable amount of time my friend had to ask for a refill and no one came by to see how anything was after we got our food. 

Overall it wasn't a terrible experience but it's not somewhere I'd make a special trip to.
Super yummy! The chicken tenders are lightly breaded and very tender cuts of chicken breast. The deep dish pizza was fantastic!

We tend to eat at night time as we live down here at downtown Las Vegas and we gamble a lot! We usually get out from the house around 10/10:30 so when it comes to food choices there aren't a lot of restaurant open; so we are just glad to some restaurants down here that are open 24/7. 

So this Chicago brewing is pretty small place. And they mostly have bar food! Service is pretty great! But it's pretty loud in here due to the place that is very confined and all the tables are pretty close together. 

We sat on the bar and played video poker, didn't really win anything but we also didn't get any comp for the drinks either. So maybe because it's a restaurant anyway.. so.. we ordered some mozzarella cheese, calamari, cowboys balls (cream cheese and corn fritters) and wings (that they claimed is never frozen) well.. they all taste like a frozen food to me! We ate 2chicken wings because they really are not that good! The calamari was ok; it was a bit tough! And mozzarella cheese were also pretty tough! But those cowboys balls are the bomb!!! Just one thing we liked! 

Service is pretty on point! He was very attentive to our needs, super polite and friendly! 

So after all; for the service alone! And the convenience of it opening late yes we will go back! But based on food; ehh probably not! :) although we didn't try their pizza though! So maybe next time and I'll write an updated review if we did!

YEAHHHH ANDREA B.!!!  We need to hang out soon!

The bestie and I came here twice.  In three days.  Sure it helped that we were staying at the Four Queens, but whatever.  The service, food, and beer were top notch, and we'll definitely be back!

Things seem aloof at first, with the self-seating and whatnot, but once you grab someone's attention, they're yours forever...  teehee.  An IPA, a root beer, garlic knots, buffalo wings (hot), and Brew-BQ pizza later, and we were in heaven.  Weeeell...  at least in heaven's foyer.  Even though we fell in love with the magical knots (GET THEM...  EVERYONE RECOMMENDING THIS IS SPOT ON), tang and heat of the wings (I'm no math teacher* or anything, but I'm preeetty sure they dumped on more than just 10 menu-stated wings on there), and the beverages (ROOT BEER = PERFECTION -- the IPA is pretty hoppy and leaves you a decent finish), we were kind of medium about the pizza.  The crust was super, and the pie itself was fresh outta the oven, but the toppings were somewhat lackluster.  Not enough bbq sauce, no seasoning on the chicken, etc.

Round 2!

Minus garlic knots (we still had leftovers in the room; might I add that they make PERFECT bedtime snacks at 7am when you return from EDC?), replace pizza with the Uptown Chicken Garlic Whatever (sorry, that's not the actual name).  And...  DIVINE INTERVENTION INDEED.  Perfectly grilled chicken, strips of sundried tomatoes, a yummy garlic presence, just the right touch of basil, all on that deliciously crispy crust.  LOVED IT!

The fifth star belongs to Bryan (? -- I think that's his name), who saved my slight coughing fit with a glass of water and a giggle, and to that fake "open nighttime sky" you can see above the smoking side of the joint.  Awesooooome.  See you again soon Chicago Brewing!
This is a hidden gem!!  Food is great,  so is the beer, and amazing root beer!  Bob has been our waiter several times and he is awesome. We would highly recommend this for a nice evening.

3.5 rounded to 4 for very good service

Dropped by here to use some comp dollars and try some food / beer.  I was curious what it would be like after the mixed reviews.

Sat in the non-bar room after noticing someone smoking in the main room...it's amazing to me that smoking is still allowed in restaurants here in Vegas?  Blah.

There are TVs all around so it's a nice place to catch the game :)

Anyways we tried a small thin crust with pepperoni and jalapeno and the garlic knots and 2 hefeweisen's and the bill was around $26 without tip.  The garlic knots were a lot of food for $5.  The pizza is on the smaller side but decent.  The beers were average, nothing spectacular but not bad.

Mike our server from Maryland was very nice and quick to help us out.  When we sat down someone actually came out from the kitchen right away and asked if we wanted menus.  Maybe the service is bad when it's more busy but the other night it was great.

I'll come back here.

Delicious pizza--- Absolutely! Oh and the crust is Vegan, and the veggies aren't soaked in butter or anything crazy so if you're vegan you can order a pizza w/out cheese and tons of veggies, and let me tell you, it's delicious.

Beer- Pretty damn good!

Service- Pretty awful. We waited foreverrrrr for our server, I'll give it to her that she was extremely nice about me be vegan (I feel like a pain in the ass, all the time) but there were three of us that would eye her while she was wandering around helping other people and she wouldn't even stop over to ask if we wanted something. It also took a long time to get our check. 

Over all it's definitely a good place to eat! watch out if you need to use the bathroom a lot, because there isn't one in the restaurant.
Very cool sports bar serving good tap beer.  The giant beers were $5 and we had a 2 for 1 coupon from the Four Queens Hotel where the Chicago Brewing Co. resides.  Great  brews.  Strongly recommend.

All I can say is that the deep dish pizza here is fantastic!  

Super good garlic knots too.  Service is good.  It's located inside the Four Queens.  If you can't find it just ask one of the staff.  I was hungry and after I ate, I wasn't.  That is all.

After two full days at bbq competition in the freezing cold weather, we just wanted a nice cozy place to rest our feet and we found it here.  Nestled in the back of The Four Queens, where we were staying, we found beer and pizza...what a great combination.  And this wasn't just any pizza, this was Chicago-style thin crust, my favorite! The pizza and garlic knots were both delicious! I also ordered a sampler flight of beer, which came with eight different beers and a sample of their root beer as well.  I was definitely impressed as was the rest of my party.  I'll definitely return next time I'm in town!

Great experience having dinner here! We were looking for affordable dinner downtown and craving pizza. I found this place on Yelp and thought we would check out Chicago Brewing. The restaurant is inside the a Four Queens casino and you need to walk up stairs to access the restaurant (I'm not sure if there is an elevator for those who need it.) The restaurant and bar area is small, maybe 15 tables maximum. We found a spot at one of the high top tables (there were only a handful of non-high tops) and were immediately greeted by a server who brought menus. We ordered the root beer, the Chicago deep dish pizza, which is a personal size pizza, garlic knots, and chicken tenders tossed in mild sauce. Everything was very good and the service was great!! We loved the pizza/marinara sauce!! The whole meal was under $30 for the 2 of us.
Perfect, quiet place to escape from Fremont and be able to talk to your friends. Appetizers and pizza were fantastic.

good happy hour food pricing and service when you can get the bartender's attention. 
I'd go back.  
Beer good, prime rib sliders a bit overcooked, but aok with tobasco.

The pizza and microbrews were just fantastic, and this was a nice little excursion after walking the downtown Fremont section of Las Vegas. 

The pizza is the traditional Midwest thin crust, but you have options. You can also order the deep dish pizza pie. I ordered mine with cheese, sausage, mushrooms and onions. The pizza was so good and close to some of the best thin crust pizzas I have had while living in the Midwest.

The bartender went over the list of microbrews that they brew themselves. I had a couple of Hefeweizens, which is my beer of choice. Really good beer. Less tart and more of a banana flavor to it. 

Overall, I had a really good experience. If you're walking the Fremont section, and you are looking for a good ol' pizza, I would strongly recommend checking this place out.

Not a huge fan of chains/franchises, yet, While in vegas it was certainly difficult to escape them. This place was the best choice for our first evening in downtown vegas.

Good Beers, good sandwiches and pizza.  Our server was great too, very friendly.
Recommend the Reck's and the IPA.

If you're in downtown vegas, and would like to try something other than the buffet, check this place out, it is inside the Four Queens Hotel (which is not specified on Urban Spoon).

This very casual sportsbar/brewery is right off the Casino Way entrance to the 4 Queens on the Fremont St Experience thoroughfare. And, for an unassuming place in a dated casino in downtown LV, I gotta say I was impressed!

I will fully admit the pizza was an afterthought after I saw the Tower of Beer sampler they offered for $8.99! The 9 different beers were surprisingly good. 8 are their regular brews w/the other one being their house-made root beer, which is delicious!

They offer Chicago deep dish pizza, but I had a thin crust that was my own concoction and it was decent. I've had better and I've definitely had worse.

The other delicious surprise were the garlic knots. Nom! Even the marinara dipping sauce was good, and I am usually not a fan!

The service was good as well. Initially our waitress was a lil brusk, but she was competent and that is what matters. She did warm up in the end. The guy waiter was a hoot and was rocking a great t-shirt that said "&!?$ Milk, Drink Beer!"   

So come for the beer and stay for the food and enjoy the Fremont St experience.

When down at Fremont this is a must stop for us. Great food, great beer, wonderful service, & an overall fabulous atmosphere. We will be back again on our next visit. Stop by this venue & you will not be disappointed.

A cozy enclave on the 2nd floor of the Four Queens to openly enjoy your cigars and enjoy the Chicago Brewery beers on tap. There is a dining area to the left and a loungy area with bar tops to the right. Garlic knots, deep dish pizzas and other goodies are served on both sides.

Service is quick and food served hot. Bartenders even remember and acknowledge us. Comfortable place to relax and watch ESPN. Ask for tasters if you're unsure of their beer on tap selection. If you gamble and know what beer you like, order the large size. Buurp!

You MUST try their deep dish pizza!!!!! It's truly the best! I go here every time I go to Vegas and it's never disappointing. It's pretty small inside and they don't have many booths. They sell their own beer and have cigars for sale as well. It does take a while for service once you seat yourself but overall worth the wait
Great little spot. Super chill server. Great food and cheap!! Worth the stop for sure!
Great pizza and beers, when you in down town Vegas this is a must, great people and atmosphere

Had the Quesadilla and it was ok.
I actually enjoyed their beer sampler the best. 
Their root beer is a must try :-)

I really liked the beer sampler, 9 samples for $10 is a great deal! They even included a non alcoholic root beer which is one of the best I've ever tasted! 
I ordered the corn fritters and potato wedges which were both very good. My friends had a chicken avocado sandwich and a deep dish pizza. The bread on the sandwich were kinda hard to eat but once the 3rd piece of bread from the club was taken out it was better. The pizza tasted good but just wasn't as deep as you would find in Chicago.

Best food downtown--by a landslide!

I came here twice while I was only in Vegas for three days!

Why?   Really good service and VERY good, fresh food.

The first time I was here, we had pizza.   The garlic knots are a must try, so a table of two could easily split an order of knots and a personal pizza and get plenty full.    SO good, I felt badly for not being able to finish my pizza!

Then next morning I went there for brunch and had a club sandwich and fries with a bloody mary--hair of the dog.    (I hear great things about the beer, but just never got a chance to try it.  Next time.)     The sandwich was fresh and warm and the fries had kind of a batter on them that was just sooo addicting. 
The bloody mary was spicier than average.  I was proud of them for not being afraid to lay the hotness on thick.   Impressive.    Hangover cured.

It's a place I couldn't get sick of, with something for everyone on the menu!
Amazing beer,  the best calamari we've ever had and the sliders were awesome.  Second time coming to this place and we'll be back again!  Best part of our trip!
We had the chicken BBQ pizza.  It wasn't bad, just not awe-inspiring.  We liked the ale, though.
Prime rib sliders, awesome.  Great spicy chicken fingers. Beer was ok, but not quite cold enough.  Nice bartender but a second bartender was needed. And you can play video poker while you drink.

I come here with my hubby every year for fb play-offs same spot, same bartender, same delicious bbq pizza.  The smoke that accumulates can be a concern for you sensitive folk. The blueberry vanilla hefenweizen goes down smooth and the homemade root beer is yummy! The stout, red & IPA brews are spot on. If sports are on come early and grab a spot, great location to just chill and watch the game. I've been here 5 years in a row and I love Kimmy's blunt attitude.  If you're picky she'll walk right past ya. Keep it simple and she'll treat ya right! Go Chargers!
Such good specials pretty solid food would recommend for that happy hour. Not so much out of happy hour, but hey we all got to survive

It is located in the 4 Queens Casino and Hotel

It's a sports bar with beer, tv's and has fantastic appetizers.
They have the tastiest barbeque chicken tenders, awesome filet mignion sliders, and great chicken wings.  We enjoyed the tenders so much that we went back the next day and had 2 orders of them.  All the appetizers are 10.00 and under.

We never tried any salads or sandwiches.  They have friendly staff as well.
The beer sampler was great, the food was good, and the service was awesome! Will definitely be coming back.

Best food I had in downtown! Most places who claim to have deep-dish Chicago pizza outside of the city usually fail, but this place has every right to make that claim. 5 of us ordered garlic knots (based on reviews!) and a personal pizza. The knots were perfectly greasy, buttery, and addicting. Us 3 ladies accidentally finished off the pizza while we chatted over Blue Moons and the guys gambled, so we had to order them another one. It was pretty close to what I remember from visiting Chicago, a deep dish with a firm, crispy crust and oozing with cheesy greatness. Very highly recommended if you're near Fremont Street.

I really wanted to like this place, and honestly the only reason it gets 2 stars is because the service was great. The beer and food, however was terrible. To start the beer sampler was flat and only cool to warm. The garlic knots had little flavor, but weren't terrible. The garlic chicken pizza was horrible, it tasted like they threw canned tomatoes on a stale cracker with canned chicken. There was no garlic, and for that matter no good flavor to to this. I for one won't ever go back as there are dozens of better places to eat on Freemont.

This is a hidden gem in downtown Vegas! Chicago tucked away in the Four Queens was an amazing place. Our friends has suggested we have dinner and drinks there so we all did!

Boy we're we surprised! We had their sliders which were so delicious my mouth is watering just thinking of them. The meat was flavorful and super tender. The calamari was absolutely perfect, something you would get at a 5 star seafood restaurant for the 1/8 of the price. The mozzarella sticks and deep dish pizza were also extremely tasty as well. Their food not only absolutely delicious but super affordable.

They also have a great drink selection and a whole Bloody Mary menu!

Their service was exceptional! Our waiter and bartender was super fast and kept checking in on us and had great suggestions for drinks and food!

If you don't like smoke I'd come during the week because it's known for being a cigar lounge. But if you can get past that you're in for a real super affordable treat!

I had high hopes for this place based on reviews. It was ok. Inside the Four Queens, it's a tiny place in the back. I had the Black Widow Stout and it was so-so. Served in a huge frosty mug apparently designed for over-indulging tourists. We ordered the deep dish pizza. It had potential, but the dough was undercooked and, well, doughy.
Beer is pretty decent. Garlic knots tasted like wonderbread. Pizza crust tasted like chewing on charcoal.  Come here for drinks, but not to eat.
