stopped in to get a bite for lunch, had the cheesesteak which was 4 stars, but their rootbeer is just mind blowing delicious. FYI it comes slightly cold in a full glass with no ice. Gets room temp pretty quick, so if you want get a glass of ice too. Like a lot of reviews it took forever to get the bill paid, finally just walked to the bar and asked for a bill and paid. I would wait a long time just for the rootbeer.

This is a cool little brewery & restaurant.  I had a thin crust pizza and it was good.  The IPA I had was just average. The root beer they have on tap was very good. Decent customer service from a nice gentleman who was one of the only few servers working during a busy afternoon.

So happy we listened to our fellow Yelpers! Had the garlic knots and shared the Chicago deep dish between the 2 of us. The food was fantastic! 
They'll provide samples of their brews - I enjoyed the old town brown the most.

The staff at this location is in one word simply AMAZING.  

On 11/23/16 My family and I happened upon this location by accident as we were catching the Elvis show here and decided to give it a shot.

Right away the energy was great as the servers Michael and Tiffany were constantly in motion and handling the patrons within moments I had my Brown Ale in hand. 

I noticed the 9" Chicago deep dish pizza for $9.99 and thought I'd give it a go.  The Pizza takes roughly 25 minutes to make and upon arriving I knew I had made a great choice.

The Pizza was hearty and cooked perfectly The cheese was holding the piece from coming out of the pie after cutting it.  The pepperoni, sausage and cheese made up the 1" thickness of the pie. I was only able to finish 1/2 of it.  Lucky for me my family was there to help finish the remaining pieces along with the house Root Beer (the menu states voted Best of Las Vegas and after tasting I see why) definitely a must try.

The next night we came back 11/23/16 and brought even more guests as we went from a party of 4 to a party of 11.  Again the service was spot on but this time we tried several appetizers.  Everything from the garlic knots with marinara sauce, mozzarella sticks and table favorite chicken tenders satisfied our need to feed.

The chicken tenders were another high quality item the breading was seasoned perfectly and 5 large juicy pieces are sure to please.

So if you happen to be around Fremont Street and have a large appetite inside the 4 Queens casino you will find this great place. 

Enjoy

Been here a time or two before, and it's always nice. But this time we walked in sat down in the restaurant down stairs and immediately were approached by promoters and they gave out free items and free shots. Perfect because we were celebrating a birthday. It was happy hour from 4-7 and our server even extended the happy hour prices past happy our. Beyond nice. Food was delicious and perfect temperature. I'd be more than happy to visit this establishment again.
Nice place, great food and Pizza. I will be going back. A great place to eat while at Fremont Street
Well this place doesn't suck!  Yum-oh! Chicago style deep dish!!! Most excellent - and the bartenders....great service!!!

I visited this place quite a while ago, but I can still distinctly remember the reasons why I haven't been back.

First, the wait...we waited a looooong time to be seated, a longer time to be waited upon, and the very longest time to receive our pizza.  I was not impressed with the service at all - if you're gonna make me wait, at least smile when you get to my table.

The pizza arrived almost 45 minutes after we placed our order and it was lukewarm, which suggested to me that it had been sitting for a while.  My fianc and I were only one of two tables at the time, so it's kind of incredible that our waitress forgot about us.  When I asked for Parmesan, I got a sticky, goopy, flat-out nasty shaker...aren't you supposed to clean those from time to time??  The pizza itself was okay...the sauce was pretty unusual.  It was a meat sauce, almost like they had run out of regular pizza sauce and subbed a pasta sauce instead.  It was bizarre-tasting and had an equally bizarre texture.

I hate feeling like I've wasted my money.  This was one meal I'd definitely take back if I could.

Our favorite place to go in Vegas. Excellent service and wings. Not to mention superb draft beer. You get a REAL drink here unlike the strip. Bob and Kimmy really make this place great!! The pipe smoker and royal flush winner!!!
Stopped in for lunch and thoroughly enjoyed the Deep Dish and Chicago Dogs. The beers were good too - I had the Irish stout!

Wow great staff... You guys rock.
Whiskey and coke...check
Stout... phenominal, 
Hefeweizen.. oh my beloved tastebuds.. Lucky Vegas goers??? (That is not a real word right hahaha?) Root beer is like old fashioned Hires made with the dry ice. I honestly would give these guys 10 stars. Thanks for a great experience.... When in Vegas this is the place.

Sitting here now and had to write a review the food was such a let down. The filet mignon sliders were such a disappointment I managed to get one bite down. The aju sauce was basically brown water, no seasonings, mushrooms tasted rotten, and it came with a side of plain lettuce?? I can't say about the beers but with food like this I could imagine drink till it tastes good

Deep dish was perfect. Cheese was the ideal texture--stringy, creamy and chewy. Perfect.! We also got a order of chicken strips with hot sauce and they hit the spot!  I enjoyed my large beer. Good meal for a late dinner.
I got really bad food poisoning from here on Sunday March 4, 2012. I think it was from a salad. Avoid at all costs! Mediocre pizza too.

Back in town selling houses and stopped in to one of my favorite brewing houses.  Bobby Dickman (yes, that is his real name- I understand he is still in counseling, lol) was tending bar, serving food, checking on patrons, and basically doing everything.
Bobby is a one man band.  The most amazing thing about Bobby is that he never forgets a face, or a name, or an order.  An affable fella.  The 4 Queens are lucky to have him.
The Philly cheesesteak was average today.  Loads of quantity. Not so much on quality.  However, the atmosphere is relaxing, the beer is cold, and Bobby's easy going nature and good humor makes this site an enjoyable experience.

Excellent beer menu and beer flights. Still allows cigars in the bar. I had the muffaletta they have the meats right but the bu and olive spread are not really well suited for a muffaletta sandwich. They would be better off calling it an Italian sandwich. The fries were awesome and the service was excellent.

Yes yes yes... and YES! 

Stopped in for a quick bite before a concert downtown and wow am I impressed and so relieved. I truly gave up on finding decent Chicago-Style pizza. Not only did I find that, but as well they have great tasting crafts on draft and iced cold! 

Started off with the sampler of crafts. Literally a carousel of 9 samples for only $9 bucks! The drinks were great and threw in a side of calamari to start. 

Now normally I have low expectations on calamari as I generally know where to go to have a great appetizer portion of calamari. (An authentic Italian restaurant!) However, this place - best Calamari since my review in Tucson. 

Ordered the Deep Dish pizza (no meat #vegetarian) and again - decent size and definitely enough for 2-3 people (with appetizers and drinks of course). The red sauce was bold but balanced. Amazing stringy cheese when you pull out a slice and not too much dough - which really set it off. 

All in all very impressed and happy to have found a go-to Chicago Style eatery in downtown Las Vegas. It's located in the Four Queens. 

The only caution I would give is if you are sensitive to cigar smoke, this may not be the place for you. Yea - that's right! It duals as a cigar bar and this guy is not offended one bit. As matter of fact the sweet smells of cigar tobacco while eating the rich buttery Deep Dish and refreshing sampler was enough to have me sit back and my chair and feel a great amount of contentment. 

An absolutely must for pizza downtown!

The signature deep dish pizza is absolutely delicious! Oooy goooey cheese, crisp crust, and fresh pizza sauce make for a perfect late night dinner. We shared the chicken strips too and they were lightly crispy and the meat was super moist, not greasy at all. Friendly service!

Located inside the Four Queens, the restaurant is easy to spot when entering. It is all self seating and a free for all in trying to find an empty table. 

This past Friday was slammed and I am not sure if Pride had anything to do with it. It could be that this restaurant is always jam packed. Anyways, our party of three found a spot near the bar and situated down. Normally the waitresses will bring the menu, but they were busy, so I snagged a couple. 

When our waitress appeared, she was quick to take our drink orders. The specialty beer right now is a Mango Hef. A pint goes for $4 and the larger one is $5. 

The menu is drastically smaller than the Rampart location, but they do have a few vegetarian friendly dishes. My friend and I ordered a Greek Salad and a Vegetarian Pizza. Our waitress was sweet enough to have the salad split for us with the dressing on the side. The amount that we each got was large. Too bad the dressing was mainly oil. Even after mixing it up, the oil was predominantly what ended up on the salad. The pizza was good. The crust was soggy in certain areas, but that tends to happen with a veggie pizza. The nice chunks of zucchini or squash, onions, tomatoes, mushrooms, and olives gave many different textures. The seasoning that they used on their crust was something we found ourselves wiping up.

Because it was so busy, the staff were not too concern with putting away dishes in a quiet manner. We heard every clank and clunk as dishes were thrown into bus tubs. There were not any refills either or an attempt to check in on us.
The deep dish pizza was awesome, the wings were good, the chicken tenders were really tender, the potatoes skins were some of the best. And the IPA was fantastic.

Normally i have an okay time here. My last visit wasnt even okay. 

I didnt even get a chance to eat here and had to leave due to the terrible service. We took a seat at the bar and ordered the deep dish pizza we were craving all diggity day long and a brown ale, along with a couple waters. Then we watched the bartenders behind the bar have internal drama and not even look in our direction as we waited.....and waited........annnnnnd waited. Neither the bar nor the dining area was busy or even half full and i sat for 17 minutes without even the orders for the waters go fulfilled. 
At that point i had seen enough and had to walk out before the food and drinks even arrived. I hated to do it but i could not support the staff and business where that could happen. 

The bottom line is that it was a bad experience but the food i have had here in the past has always been solid, the beer is surprisingly good and priced very well.

Usually go for pizza. But this time went for salad,nothing special. And mild wings,naked. Very delicious. Also got chicken tenders. Juicy and big. Very delicious too. Good to know there's other options. A must place to eat while you're in downtown Vegas.

The Chicago style deep dish pizza is to die for! My husband and I agree this is one of the best pizzas we've ever had! We stumbled in here by accident and now we always make a stop here. Feels like a hidden treasure. We actually had it two days in a row.. beats the buffet in quality and flavor. The bread is so soft and doughy. The cheese is so flavorful, you can tell it's top quality.

Great wings, good pizza, and cheap beer. I don't think you could really go wrong if you came here. 

Also the waitress we had was really nice, we had a ton of leftovers and where about to leave them behind because we where going straight from the restaurant to a bar and didn't want to cart the food around so she offered to put them in a box and leave them for us back behind the counter and even if the place was closed by the tie we came back, she said we could still come in and get our food.

I've been to Chicago and had pizza, and I've been to a lot of restaurants that advertise Chicago-style pizza. With the exception of one restaurant, that being Chicago Brewing Company in the Four Queens Hotel & Casino, not one of them has actually lived up to the claim of having real Chicago-style pizza.
Fortunately, this is that restaurant, so this is a positive review! They apparently have another location across town, but this is the one I've dined in. Several times, in fact.
The restaurant occupies a little nook in the corner of the Four Queens, and though the prices aren't super-cheap (though you can go across the street to one of the sports bars if dollar-fifty hot dogs are your thing), they're quite fair, and the garlic knots include a surprising amount of sustenance for the price. The beers are apparently brewed at the other location, but they're still local, and they're still delicious. So I recommend them highly.
Get the sampler flight. It's not only eye-catching to have a bunch of wee mugs artfully presented on a two-tiered tray, it's a great way of finding out which of the beers you think you'll like are what you really want to drink, and which beers you weren't sure if you'd like at all are actually a lot better than you'd expected. That's how I found their fruity wheat beer (I think it may have been blueberry), and how we decided what to bring home in a growler.
For the pizza? Get it. It's as close as I've ever found to being real Chicago-style pizza, like I've said before. Reviewers of the other location that are *from Chicago* concur. Maybe it's just not entirely possible to make Chicago-style pizza anywhere but Chicago, but these guys come close and it's delicious to boot. They may have other offerings on the menu, but I never bothered to try because I was so happy to find real Chicago-style pizza.
I feel I've probably not said Chicago-style pizza enough times. Chicago-style pizza. Chicago-style pizza. Chicago-style pizza. There we go.
Anyway, if you like what I keep talking about, then go here. If you've never had Chicago-style pizza (in Chicago or anywhere else), try it here if you're in Vegas. Definitely worth the stop.

Very nice place, clean bar area. Its located in 4 queens, kind of hidden though, in the corner of the casino, where you have to walk up stairs. I honestly wouldnt have known about this place had it not been for the reviews on Yelp.

The bad: Not exactly bad, but I wasn't all that impressed with their deep dish. Ive been to Chicago on several occasions, and while I dont know about their regular pizza, the deep dish doesnt taste anywhere remotely close to Chicago. Still good though, and for 10 bucks, not much to complain about. If it was $15 or more, I'd be ticked.

The good: The happy hour. FANTASTIC!!!! Its Mon-Fri from 3-6pm, all apps 1/2 price. The apps were just straight up awesome. I had the wings, calamari, and chicken tenders. Ate the first 2, boxed the last to have later as a snack.  They also had $3 in house beers, but I dont drink beer, so no review there.

Overall, a nice little diamond in the rough. Wasn't crowded, service was good, food was great. Will definitely come back for their happy hour when I visit Vegas again.

Our group of 4 stopped in here this past Friday night because we were all craving pizza. Found a spot to sit in a back corner, and we were greeted pretty quickly. Waiter was friendly and attentive considering they were pretty packed and quickly brought us drinks. We had garlic knots, mozzarella sticks and two 16" pizzas and had quite a bit of pizza leftover. Everything was delicious! I've never seen so many pepperonis on a pizza in my life. Prices were extremely fair, too.

Among the many...and I mean many.. bartenders in this amazing city, Bob stands among the best. The Man knows his beer and his football, as well. Bartender Kimmie is amazing, too...as is Tiffany...as is Mike...and don't get me started on the kick ass kitchen crew. Two thumbs way UP!!!!

Their garlic cheese knots were to die for! LOVED them! They beers were just OK. Their homemade Root Beer was very tasty. The only bad things I would say about this place: my grandfather was in a wheelchair & due to it's 2nd floor location, it was tricky to get to - we had to go up the elevator & through another restaurant to get to it. Also there is limited seating. One side is smoking section & the other is non smoking both are very small. Visiting this place was definitely worth it for the Root Beer & the Cheese Knots. The pizza was just OK.

Not really a true brewery... It's a small room inside the 4 Queens. The "brewery" is offsite 7 miles away. 
As a home brewer the beers were nothing I couldn't make at home myself... Maybe I should talk to 4 Queens and I could get a brewery! LOL
Unless you just want to check another "brewery" off your list... Not really worth checking out.

This review is only for beer and cigars at the Chicago Brewing Company.  We stopped in here a couple weeks ago and sat at the bar.  The bartender was super friendly and helpful.  I had the beer sampler (see pic) and all the beers were delicious.  Each one seemed to accurately represent that particular style of brewing.  My favorites were the Ramblin Reck Amber Ale, the Old Town Brown and the IPA.  I also smoked a great cigar at the bar.  The food coming out of the kitchen looked great and next time I'll definitely eat.  The beer was really outstanding and so was the service.  Chicago Brewing Company is located on the second floor of Four Queens.  I've been in the casino many times and never seen the restaurant until the day we went there.  The ambiance is typical neighborhood bar...very comfortable and casual.  I'll be back at here every time I'm in the downtown area.  Beer-5 stars, Service-4 stars, Ambiance-3 stars, Value-5 stars, Food-no rating.

I don't get down to Fremont Street as much as I did in the past. Let's face it, depending on when you go, the area can be quite sketchy. When I do get down there though, Chicago Brewing is one of the main reasons for it. The staff has always been great, and the beers really good, especially on a hot Vegas day or night.

I really like the pizza, and they do have plenty of other items other than pizza. But, those garlic knots with marinara sauce are the bomb. Put a plate of those in front of me with a tall one, and I'm a happy camper. The place is small, but i think that's part of the charm of it. It would loose some of the allure to me if it was any bigger. Prices are decent as well.

If you like good food, good beer, friendly people, then you're at the right place. But damn, get you some of those garlic knots.

This place was a good place to go for a little snack. We both got a side salad and our own order of wings. The wings were a big portion, and we even took some home. The salad was nothing great, iceburg lettuce a couple grape tomatoes. They are famous for their Bloody Mary menu, and my husband loved it. We always stay at the Four Queens so it was convenient. They have TV, all sports related.

Decent beer.  The pours are extremely nice here.  You can buy a pitcher of IPA for $20, or a 32 Oz for $13.  We got the pitcher.

The IPA is decent.  It's really a standard IPA.  No complaints about it.  I'd say it's on par w/ BJ's Brewery.

Awesome food! Pizza is great!! I recommend the thin crust. Very crispy, perfect amount of toppings and tasty. Friendly, fast service. Highly recommended.
Chicago deep dish doors not even come close to Gino's or Giordano's. The happy hour specials are awesome. highly recommend the filet sliders.
I love a good IPA and the Chicago Brew Co has a good one. Albiet a small bar its big on taste and I opt for the sliders and an IPA when I go and leave fat and happy.
Deep dish pizzas are small but will definitely fill you up. The food was awesome but the restaurant was small. However I would go back for sure when I'm in Las Vegas.

Beer was ok, but the in house root beer was fantastic - give it a shot. The food was ok, but certainly one of the better options Freemont and the prices were right. 

Our waiter was very pleasant. Was not swooned by the place, but I'd return if I was in the area.

Pizza is pretty good, service not so much. Mellow mood on a Sunday afternoon during football season. Deep dish pizza is super saucy which I loved. Too bad it's the second time I've been here and service fell short both times ... don't think I'll come back.

I really would give this place four stars if it wasn't for the fact they allow smoking in the bar. Cigars too, which I guess is a selling point with them. I was under the impression that a bar that serves food in Nevada couldn't have smoking, but I guess not here. It's too bad really because the food is good, the beer was awesome, and the bartenders were friendly, but ultimately I couldn't take noxious cigar smoke from other patrons wafting over my food. Just a thing to keep in mind if you're a non-smoker.

in my opinion, pizza & beer is kinda hard to mess up, but this place is really, really good.  i'm  a fan of Chicago's Lou Malnatis and this place is almost as good.  if you can't fly to Chicago for pizza, then definitely enjoy the pizza here.

Gambling at the bar was ignored by the bartenders and staff the people their right now 9/3/17 should all be let go I can't believe how terrible this place is and I will reflect it to all my guest downtown

Pizza and beer. A match made in heaven. I've been hearing some great word of mouth about this place for ages and have been dying to try it. Finally, I got my chance. 

I ordered the white pizza and a hef. The garlicky goodness was so badass. I love when white pizza is done right. It's a hard trick, but they pull it off flawlessly. The beer is fantastic as well. I'm psyched to try their rootbeer on my next trip. It looked so refreshing, 

There are quite a few other menu items that caught my eye as well, so I look forward to my next visit there. It'll definitely be sooner than later. I'll have to add this to my regular rotation in town. 

Love it.
Get off the beaten path and try this place out!  Great food, great service and reasonable prices.  A must to try is the blackened chicken quesadilla.
